name: Gundruk Soup
description: A tangy soup made from fermented leafy greens (like mustard, radish, cauliflower leaves), cooked with onions, tomatoes and spices. A warming dish especially in cold weather in Sikkim.

name: Sel Roti
description: Ring-shaped, deep-fried bread made from fermented rice batter. Crispy outside, soft inside. Often eaten during festivals or with tea or curry.

name: Phagshapa
description: A rich pork dish cooked with strips of pork fat, radishes and dried red chillies. Bold flavours, popular among meat-eaters in Sikkim.

name: Thukpa
description: A hearty noodle soup (vegetarian or with meat) influenced by Tibetan cuisine. Contains vegetables, meat or tofu in a flavorful broth. Comforting in cold mountain weather.

name: Chhurpi
description: A traditional cheese made from cow or yak milk. Comes in hard and soft varieties. Used as a chew-snack or cooked into soups or curries.
